segment.source: Devices Restrict CD-ROM access to locally logged-on user only (Windows 10)
segment.target: Devices Restrict CD-ROM access to locally logged-on user only (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Devices Restrict CD-ROM access to locally logged-on user only security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Devices Restrict CD-ROM access to locally logged-on user only security policy setting.

segment.source: Devices: Restrict CD-ROM access to locally logged-on user only
segment.target: Devices: Restrict CD-ROM access to locally logged-on user only

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Devices: Restrict CD-ROM access to locally logged-on user only security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Devices: Restrict CD-ROM access to locally logged-on user only security policy setting.

segment.source: This policy setting determines whether a CD is accessible to local and remote users simultaneously.
segment.target: This policy setting determines whether a CD is accessible to local and remote users simultaneously.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, only the interactively logged-on user is allowed to access removable CDs.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, only the interactively logged-on user is allowed to access removable CDs.

segment.source: If this policy setting is enabled and no one is logged on interactively, the CD can be accessed over the network.
segment.target: If this policy setting is enabled and no one is logged on interactively, the CD can be accessed over the network.

segment.source: The security benefit of enabling this policy setting is small because it only prevents network users from accessing the drive when someone is logged on to the local console of the system at the same time.
segment.target: The security benefit of enabling this policy setting is small because it only prevents network users from accessing the drive when someone is logged on to the local console of the system at the same time.

segment.source: Additionally, CD drives are not automatically made available as network shared drives; you must deliberately choose to share the drive.
segment.target: Additionally, CD drives are not automatically made available as network shared drives; you must deliberately choose to share the drive.

segment.source: This is important when administrators are installing software or copying data from a CD-ROM, and they do not want network users to be able to execute the applications or view the data.
segment.target: This is important when administrators are installing software or copying data from a CD-ROM, and they do not want network users to be able to execute the applications or view the data.

segment.source: If this policy setting is enabled, users who connect to the server over the network will not be able to use any CD drives that are installed on the server when anyone is logged on to the local console of the server.
segment.target: If this policy setting is enabled, users who connect to the server over the network will not be able to use any CD drives that are installed on the server when anyone is logged on to the local console of the server.

segment.source: Enabling this policy setting is not suitable for a system that serves as a CD jukebox for network users.
segment.target: Enabling this policy setting is not suitable for a system that serves as a CD jukebox for network users.

segment.source: Best practices are dependent on your security and user accessibility requirements for CD drives.
segment.target: Best practices are dependent on your security and user accessibility requirements for CD drives.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.
segment.target: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: A remote user could potentially access a mounted CD that contains sensitive information.
segment.target: A remote user could potentially access a mounted CD that contains sensitive information.

segment.source: This risk is small because CD drives are not automatically made available as shared drives; you must deliberately choose to share the drive.
segment.target: This risk is small because CD drives are not automatically made available as shared drives; you must deliberately choose to share the drive.

segment.source: However, you can deny network users the ability to view data or run applications from removable media on the server.
segment.target: However, you can deny network users the ability to view data or run applications from removable media on the server.

segment.source: Enable the Devices: Restrict CD-ROM drive access to locally logged-on user only setting.
segment.target: Enable the Devices: Restrict CD-ROM drive access to locally logged-on user only setting.

segment.source: Users who connect to the server over the network cannot use any CD drives that are installed on the server when anyone is logged on to the local console of the server.
segment.target: Users who connect to the server over the network cannot use any CD drives that are installed on the server when anyone is logged on to the local console of the server.

segment.source: System tools that require access to the CD drive will fail.
segment.target: System tools that require access to the CD drive will fail.

segment.source: For example, the Volume Shadow Copy service attempts to access all CD and floppy disk drives that are present on the computer when it initializes, and if the service cannot access one of these drives, it fails.
segment.target: For example, the Volume Shadow Copy service attempts to access all CD and floppy disk drives that are present on the computer when it initializes, and if the service cannot access one of these drives, it fails.

segment.source: This condition causes the Windows Backup tool to fail if volume shadow copies were specified for the backup job.
segment.target: This condition causes the Windows Backup tool to fail if volume shadow copies were specified for the backup job.

segment.source: Any non-Microsoft backup products that use volume shadow copies also fail.
segment.target: Any non-Microsoft backup products that use volume shadow copies also fail.

segment.source: This policy setting would not be suitable for a computer that serves as a CD jukebox for network users.
segment.target: This policy setting would not be suitable for a computer that serves as a CD jukebox for network users.
